A Israel Security Supplemental Appropriations Act, 2024 <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD12D81FFEA045469AA416918BB68140" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="undesignated-section"> That the following sums are appropriated, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes, namely: <title id="H94C0E17D58574D799E0DC3C964CA19D2" qb-display-quote="yes" style="OLC"> I <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="id50147BACC0494AD38CD363DB41773BAE" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCDF4F616091D4839A027D6522AF6838E" qb-display-quote="yes"> Department of Defense <subsection id="H4DCC68C2ADA7470F9EA7AF0279C906DC" qb-display-quote="yes"> Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6351E605FFFD44B0B731A92A9F64245A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (Including Transfers of Funds) For an additional amount for <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide, $4,400,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2025, to respond to the situation in Israel: Provided, That the amount provided under this heading in this division may be transferred to accounts under the headings <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Operation and Maintenance, <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Procurement, and <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Revolving and Management Funds for replacement, through new procurement or repair of existing unserviceable equipment, of defense articles from the stocks of the Department of Defense, and for reimbursement for defense services of the Department of Defense and military education and training, provided to the government of Israel or identified and notified to Congress for provision to the government of Israel or to foreign countries that have provided support to Israel at the request of the United States: Provided further, That funds transferred pursuant to the preceding proviso shall be merged with and available for the same purposes and for the same time period as the appropriations to which the funds are transferred: Provided further, That the Secretary of Defense shall notify the congressional defense committees of the details of such transfers not less than 15 days before any such transfer: Provided further, That upon a determination that all or part of the funds transferred from this appropriation are not necessary for the purposes provided herein, such amounts may be transferred back and merged with this appropriation: Provided further, That any transfer authority provided herein is in addition to any other transfer authority provided by law: Provided further, That such amount is designated by the Congress as being for an emergency requirement pursuant to section 251(b)(2)(A)(i) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF05B1D9BF56D4A9984D97BBF1F46BF77" qb-display-quote="yes"> Procurement <subsection quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Procurement of Ammunition, Army, $801,400,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, to respond to the situation in Israel: Provided, That such amount is designated by the Congress as being for an emergency requirement pursuant to section 251(b)(2)(A)(i) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF05B1D9BF56D4A9984D97BBF1F46BF77" qb-display-quote="yes"> Procurement <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H96DDD92D34D140E39B2DBF3C1F5A1F99" qb-display-quote="yes"> Procurement of Ammunition, Army For an additional amount for <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Procurement of Ammunition, Army, $801,400,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, to respond to the situation in Israel: Provided, That such amount is designated by the Congress as being for an emergency requirement pursuant to section 251(b)(2)(A)(i) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H196D624CDFD24B73B36F2BFAA64FF358" qb-display-quote="yes"> Procurement, Defense-Wide For an additional amount for <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Procurement, Defense-Wide, $5,200,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, to respond to the situation in Israel and for related expenses: Provided, That of the total amount provided under this heading in this division, $4,000,000,000 shall be for the Secretary of Defense to provide to the Government of Israel for the procurement of the Iron Dome and David’s Sling defense systems to counter short-range rocket threats: Provided further, That of the total amount provided under this heading in this division, $1,200,000,000 shall be for the Secretary of Defense to provide to the Government of Israel for the procurement of the Iron Beam defense system to counter short-range rocket threats: Provided further, That funds in the preceding provisos shall be transferred pursuant to an exchange of letters and are in addition to funds provided pursuant to the U.S.-Israel Iron Dome Procurement Agreement, as amended: Provided further, That nothing under this heading in this division shall be construed to apply to amounts made available in prior appropriations Acts for the procurement of the Iron Dome and David's Sling defense systems or for the procurement of the Iron Beam defense system: Provided further, That such amount is designated by the Congress as being for an emergency requirement pursuant to section 251(b)(2)(A)(i) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1746ECA574314B2A8CFAE06E2115933A" qb-display-quote="yes"> Defense Production Act Purchases For an 609a(c)(2), the Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency may permit a State to use up to two percent of a grant awarded under this heading in this division to provide outreach and technical assistance to eligible nonprofit organizations to assist them with applying for Nonprofit Security Grant Program awards under this heading in this division: Provided further, That such outreach and technical assistance should prioritize rural and underserved communities and nonprofit organizations that are traditionally underrepresented in the Program: Provided further, That such amount is designated by the Congress as being for an emergency requirement pursuant to section 251(b)(2)(A)(i) of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985. <title <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H932EF7452AF84153BC49E80026004076" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Terms Repayment required by the arrangement required by subsection (a) shall be at terms to be set by the President. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2CEB5B1D1BDD43D1B7448F2CFA60763B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Limitation on Arrangement Terms The arrangement required pursuant to subsection (a) may not provide for the cancellation of any or all amounts of indebtedness except as provided in subsection (d). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H066C7508CB794F46A3501FAA83110ED4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Cancellation of Indebtedness <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H950E6EC9645445DFAF8724BCA51860E3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) The President may not before November 15, 2024 take any action related to the indebtedness of the Government of Ukraine that cancels any indebtedness incurred by Ukraine pursuant to this section.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6565DB75BDC24A788AF579B067F2BA28" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 508. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE2F97317B1D54E16904969FCD0A312E6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Report Required <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H41A35236680E43F196E42A27CDEDF1FA" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In General Notwithstanding any other provision of law, before taking any action described in paragraph (2), the President shall submit to Congress a written report that describes that action and the reason for that action. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H06CC121E391844979FB6410D82B7EFBF" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Action Described An action described in this paragraph is an action related to the indebtedness of the Government of Ukraine authorized by section 507(d)(1).

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCD62687499B54120BC5D6399D2DCCA9C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Congressional Review Period <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8F299241C1D7418C9062263A0FE00A82" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) 2024 During calendar year 2024, if the President submits to Congress a report under subsection (a)(1), the President may not take any action with respect to the indebtedness of the Government of Ukraine until the earlier of— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6E5688CCF60D4978AC8826247E4FE5AB" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the date that is 10 calendar days after the date of such submission; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF7266A5D87294F4A90B2E1337F450E6D" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the date on which Congress has considered and failed to pass a joint resolution of disapproval, as provided in this section. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5CFA691E75784F99986921BCC63502D0" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Succeeding Years <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H92DC9E2179634F93A1272E4F7F3CD431" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In General During calendar year 2025 or any calendar year thereafter, if the President submits to Congress a report under subsection (a)(1), the President may not take any action with respect to the indebtedness of the Government of Ukraine until the earlier of— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCC54B5412A3E432A8B9F1740B2A0071E" indent="subparagraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the date that is 30 calendar days after the date of such submission, except as provided in subparagraph (B); or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H738B1B04174D4097BC502ED9D05D7ACC" indent="subparagraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the date on which Congress has considered and failed to pass a joint resolution of disapproval, as provided in this section. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC61C7FB4DA8849E5B0C98609C8997A53" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Exception The period for congressional review of a report submitted under subsection (a)(1) shall be 60 calendar days if the report is submitted to Congress on or after July 10 and on or before September 7 in any calendar year.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5CFA691E75784F99986921BCC63502D0" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Succeeding Years <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H92DC9E2179634F93A1272E4F7F3CD431" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In General During calendar year 2025 or any calendar year thereafter, if the President submits to Congress a report under subsection (a)(1), the President may not take any action with respect to the indebtedness of the Government of Ukraine until the earlier of— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCC54B5412A3E432A8B9F1740B2A0071E" indent="subparagraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the date that is 30 calendar days after the date of such submission, except as provided in subparagraph (B); or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H738B1B04174D4097BC502ED9D05D7ACC" indent="subparagraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the date on which Congress has considered and failed to pass a joint resolution of disapproval, as provided in this section. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC61C7FB4DA8849E5B0C98609C8997A53" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Exception The period for congressional review of a report submitted under subsection (a)(1) shall be 60 calendar days if the report is submitted to Congress on or after July 10 and on or before September 7 in any calendar year. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02FE787C2DE34DA8B7E6AB2C9EBC05FB" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Veto Message If the President vetoes a joint resolution of disapproval, he may not take any action with respect to the indebtedness of Ukraine for 5 calendar days after the veto message is received by the appropriate House of Congress.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC61C7FB4DA8849E5B0C98609C8997A53" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Exception The period for congressional review of a report submitted under subsection (a)(1) shall be 60 calendar days if the report is submitted to Congress on or after July 10 and on or before September 7 in any calendar year. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02FE787C2DE34DA8B7E6AB2C9EBC05FB" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Veto Message If the President vetoes a joint resolution of disapproval, he may not take any action with respect to the indebtedness of Ukraine for 5 calendar days after the veto message is received by the appropriate House of Congress. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF8A9498C0D7C4AC2B71D9AFEBABA0581" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Joint Resolution of Disapproval In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">joint resolution means only a joint resolution— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6D14A630D5324645B280F689749652E3" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) that is introduced not later than 3 calendar days after the date on which a report of the President referred to in subsection (a)(1) is received by Congress; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H353C52A4092F4493932641311D17EAB3" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) which does not have a preamble; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H863F6CEFE4F04F09920DEEE6F96005EA" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the title of which is as follows: <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Joint resolution relating to the disapproval of the Presidential report with respect to the indebtedness of the Government of Ukraine; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE0A333912F104236900B18A780786CD2" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) the matter after the resolving clause of which is as follows: <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">That Congress disapproves the proposal relating to the indebtedness of the Government of Ukraine submitted by the President of the United States to Congress on _____, with the blank space filled with the appropriate date of submission of the report under subsection (a)(1).

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF8A9498C0D7C4AC2B71D9AFEBABA0581" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Joint Resolution of Disapproval In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">joint resolution means only a joint resolution— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6D14A630D5324645B280F689749652E3" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) that is introduced not later than 3 calendar days after the date on which a report of the President referred to in subsection (a)(1) is received by Congress; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H353C52A4092F4493932641311D17EAB3" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) which does not have a preamble; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H863F6CEFE4F04F09920DEEE6F96005EA" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the title of which is as follows: <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Joint resolution relating to the disapproval of the Presidential report with respect to the indebtedness of the Government of Ukraine; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE0A333912F104236900B18A780786CD2" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) the matter after the resolving clause of which is as follows: <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">That Congress disapproves the proposal relating to the indebtedness of the Government of Ukraine submitted by the President of the United States to Congress on _____, with the blank space filled with the appropriate date of submission of the report under subsection (a)(1). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8B4DE92FC8094D89BD687D7912F7D6F9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Fast-track Consideration in House of Representatives <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE7AFDDFF32BA4253BB77D4C7E43F4843" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Reporting and Discharge Any committee of the House of Representatives to which a joint resolution is referred shall report the joint resolution to the House of Representatives not later than 5 calendar days after the date on which Congress receives the report described in subsection (a)(1). If a committee fails to report the joint resolution within that period, the committee shall be discharged from further consideration of the joint resolution and the joint resolution shall be referred to the appropriate calendar.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF8A9498C0D7C4AC2B71D9AFEBABA0581" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Joint Resolution of Disapproval In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">joint resolution means only a joint resolution— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6D14A630D5324645B280F689749652E3" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) that is introduced not later than 3 calendar days after the date on which a report of the President referred to in subsection (a)(1) is received by Congress; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H353C52A4092F4493932641311D17EAB3" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) which does not have a preamble; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H863F6CEFE4F04F09920DEEE6F96005EA" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the title of which is as follows: <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Joint resolution relating to the disapproval of the Presidential report with respect to the indebtedness of the Government of Ukraine; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE0A333912F104236900B18A780786CD2" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) the matter after the resolving clause of which is as follows: <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">That Congress disapproves the proposal relating to the indebtedness of the Government of Ukraine submitted by the President of the United States to Congress on _____, with the blank space filled with the appropriate date of submission of the report under subsection (a)(1). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8B4DE92FC8094D89BD687D7912F7D6F9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Fast-track Consideration in House of Representatives <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE7AFDDFF32BA4253BB77D4C7E43F4843" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Reporting and Discharge Any committee of the House of Representatives to which a joint resolution is referred shall report the joint resolution to the House of Representatives not later than 5 calendar days after the date on which Congress receives the report described in subsection (a)(1). If a committee fails to report the joint resolution within that period, the committee shall be discharged from further consideration of the joint resolution and the joint resolution shall be referred to the appropriate calendar.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8B4DE92FC8094D89BD687D7912F7D6F9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Fast-track Consideration in House of Representatives <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE7AFDDFF32BA4253BB77D4C7E43F4843" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Reporting and Discharge Any committee of the House of Representatives to which a joint resolution is referred shall report the joint resolution to the House of Representatives not later than 5 calendar days after the date on which Congress receives the report described in subsection (a)(1). If a committee fails to report the joint resolution within that period, the committee shall be discharged from further consideration of the joint resolution and the joint resolution shall be referred to the appropriate calendar. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H68182E23D0C54C32971F42F0FC041A6D" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Proceeding to Consideration After each committee authorized to consider a joint resolution reports the joint resolution to the House of Representatives or has been discharged from its consideration, it shall be in order, not later than the 6th calendar day after the date on which Congress receives the report described in subsection (a)(1), to move to proceed to consider the joint resolution in the House of Representatives.

If a committee fails to report the joint resolution within that period, the committee shall be discharged from further consideration of the joint resolution and the joint resolution shall be referred to the appropriate calendar. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H68182E23D0C54C32971F42F0FC041A6D" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Proceeding to Consideration After each committee authorized to consider a joint resolution reports the joint resolution to the House of Representatives or has been discharged from its consideration, it shall be in order, not later than the 6th calendar day after the date on which Congress receives the report described in subsection (a)(1), to move to proceed to consider the joint resolution in the House of Representatives. All points of order against the motion are waived.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDBEE919E3BC24E519BD826966008C1B2" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Consideration The joint resolution shall be considered as read. All points of order against the joint resolution and against its consideration are waived. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on the joint resolution to its passage without intervening motion except two hours of debate equally divided and controlled by the proponent and an opponent.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9D2C28BD38CD4249A38D50B610D17F38" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Periods Described The periods described in this subparagraph are the following: <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3825F7D45C2147CD909DD91BBA111AF9" indent="subparagraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) During calendar year 2024, the period beginning on the day after the date on which the joint resolution was placed on the calendar and ending on the 4th day after the date on which the joint resolution was placed on the calendar. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H89A39B2AFC7A417BABDCDD76E7C8A73A" indent="subparagraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) During succeeding years under subsection (b)(2)(A), the period beginning on the day after the date on which the joint resolution was placed on the calendar and ending 20 calendar days later. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFA5F638CE0B34335824A52F0F750C5A0" indent="subparagraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) During succeeding years under subsection (b)(2)(B), the period beginning on the day after the date on which the joint resolution was placed on the calendar and ending 50 calendar days later.

A motion further to limit debate is in order and not debatable. An amendment to, or a motion to postpone, or a motion to proceed to the consideration of other business, or a motion to recommit the joint resolution is not in order. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H689C0ECA997842C88C6806D59A2BCE49" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) Vote on Passage The vote on passage shall occur immediately following the conclusion of the debate on a joint resolution and a single quorum call at the conclusion of the debate if requested in accordance with the rules of the Senate.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H689C0ECA997842C88C6806D59A2BCE49" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) Vote on Passage The vote on passage shall occur immediately following the conclusion of the debate on a joint resolution and a single quorum call at the conclusion of the debate if requested in accordance with the rules of the Senate. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1BC0EDD43DF45AAB27F128980E08FE8" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) Rulings of the Chair on Procedure Appeals from the decisions of the Chair relating to the application of the rules of the Senate, as the case may be, to the procedure relating to a joint resolution shall be decided without debate. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2945D43704BC449E9EAE7BCB9F36E713" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) One Joint Resolution of Disapproval per Review Period Only one joint resolution shall be in order during each of the review periods described in subsection (b), unless the additional joint resolution is a joint resolution of the House of Representatives considered under paragraph (2) or (3) of subsection (f).

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1BC0EDD43DF45AAB27F128980E08FE8" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) Rulings of the Chair on Procedure Appeals from the decisions of the Chair relating to the application of the rules of the Senate, as the case may be, to the procedure relating to a joint resolution shall be decided without debate. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2945D43704BC449E9EAE7BCB9F36E713" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) One Joint Resolution of Disapproval per Review Period Only one joint resolution shall be in order during each of the review periods described in subsection (b), unless the additional joint resolution is a joint resolution of the House of Representatives considered under paragraph (2) or (3) of subsection (f). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9E152FDAE0B646BE84EE7577CDFE799A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) Rules Relating to Senate and House of Representatives <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA55256531731495B8E1B10F31F1355DC" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Coordination with Action by Other House If, before the passage by one House of a joint resolution of that House, that House receives from the other House a joint resolution, then the following procedures shall apply: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2F35549159D84F33A2A91769A499F98C" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) The joint resolution of the other House shall not be referred to a committee.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2945D43704BC449E9EAE7BCB9F36E713" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) One Joint Resolution of Disapproval per Review Period Only one joint resolution shall be in order during each of the review periods described in subsection (b), unless the additional joint resolution is a joint resolution of the House of Representatives considered under paragraph (2) or (3) of subsection (f). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9E152FDAE0B646BE84EE7577CDFE799A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) Rules Relating to Senate and House of Representatives <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA55256531731495B8E1B10F31F1355DC" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Coordination with Action by Other House If, before the passage by one House of a joint resolution of that House, that House receives from the other House a joint resolution, then the following procedures shall apply: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2F35549159D84F33A2A91769A499F98C" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) The joint resolution of the other House shall not be referred to a committee. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H80C9109491314739856F8AFF8B300591" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) With respect to a joint resolution of the House receiving the resolution— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1D09D9400BEA4FB2AB6F57511CFA64BB" indent="subparagraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the procedure in that House shall be the same as if no joint resolution had been received from the other House; but <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H70E7F1C63993438E9E7CD5A572177ED2" indent="subparagraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the vote on passage shall be on the joint resolution of the other House.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9E152FDAE0B646BE84EE7577CDFE799A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) Rules Relating to Senate and House of Representatives <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA55256531731495B8E1B10F31F1355DC" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Coordination with Action by Other House If, before the passage by one House of a joint resolution of that House, that House receives from the other House a joint resolution, then the following procedures shall apply: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2F35549159D84F33A2A91769A499F98C" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) The joint resolution of the other House shall not be referred to a committee. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H80C9109491314739856F8AFF8B300591" indent="paragraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) With respect to a joint resolution of the House receiving the resolution— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1D09D9400BEA4FB2AB6F57511CFA64BB" indent="subparagraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the procedure in that House shall be the same as if no joint resolution had been received from the other House; but <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H70E7F1C63993438E9E7CD5A572177ED2" indent="subparagraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the vote on passage shall be on the joint resolution of the other House. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE105D63127394D4EB0AC27417AA1A700" indent="subsection" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Treatment of Joint Resolution of Other House If one House fails to introduce or consider a joint resolution under this section, the joint resolution of the other House shall be entitled to expedited floor procedures under this section.

DEFINITIONS In this division: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCD3EC4501CBF4CEA89EB0F68066186C6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Appropriate congressional committees The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">appropriate congressional committees means— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3B086C9AC97842E2954FDDA6A8782574" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs of the Senate; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEB19BE821EEA4D77B8B5F281D01F2AB9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the Committee on Foreign Relations of the Senate; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H43967216977044C49FC8B91187C82130" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) the Committee on Financial Services of the House of Representatives; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1498C5846FE746A5A881752869AB4B7C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) the Committee on Foreign Affairs of the House of Representatives. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H18B58D97811C4971BB3C794A3B6412FF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Foreign person The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">foreign person— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCFDF3FCF9FC84E559258BCE63B19F914" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) means— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5B2688B0F3C249CDA38872EAE0FE7985" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) any citizen or national of a foreign country; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H06A8AD1956424916BB2EDA01670BB485" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) any entity not organized under the laws of the United States or a jurisdiction within the United States; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H593D9B965DAA4A9D8E1C4879479E78E1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) does not include the government of a foreign country. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD562DA6736B7467587C1F9B46CA85F38" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Knowingly The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">knowingly, with respect to conduct, a circumstance, or a result, means that a person has actual knowledge, or should have known, of the conduct, the circumstance, or the result.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H18B58D97811C4971BB3C794A3B6412FF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Foreign person The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">foreign person— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCFDF3FCF9FC84E559258BCE63B19F914" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) means— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5B2688B0F3C249CDA38872EAE0FE7985" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) any citizen or national of a foreign country; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H06A8AD1956424916BB2EDA01670BB485" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) any entity not organized under the laws of the United States or a jurisdiction within the United States; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H593D9B965DAA4A9D8E1C4879479E78E1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) does not include the government of a foreign country. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD562DA6736B7467587C1F9B46CA85F38" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Knowingly The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">knowingly, with respect to conduct, a circumstance, or a result, means that a person has actual knowledge, or should have known, of the conduct, the circumstance, or the result. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1BEABE771DE8427AAA6AA8CEA5739AAD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Trafficking The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">trafficking, with respect to fentanyl, fentanyl precursors, or other related opioids, has the meaning given the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">opioid trafficking in section 7203(8) of the Fentanyl Sanctions Act (21 U.S.C.

2302(8)). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2A06AD276A5E48AAA1D633355E08A976" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Transnational criminal organization The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">transnational criminal organization includes— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAA05BD891E0D4BD8923FD401617168AB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) any organization designated as a significant transnational criminal organization under part 590 of title 31, Code of Federal Regulations; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFE553C62B3FA411587E88FA37FC3F1B7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) any of the organizations known as— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H328BF0F374514E0982C386D83289E076" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the Sinaloa Cartel; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA7BCC384D86C46CCA704FE632C78E864" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the Jalisco New Generation Cartel; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HACC9460211DF4DDCB989C3E21F8963E3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) the Gulf Cartel; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0BE90DFD29024F47BF0BFD4C9516D8FD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) the Los Zetas Cartel; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H81120309896F4A1ABD2A5C009C85E29B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (v) the Juarez Cartel; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0BBD84340E684771BA264D85337219AC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (vi) the Tijuana Cartel; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE0875E66868E43B8B54D9580234446CC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (vii) the Beltran-Leyva Cartel; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H12470E9EA6934B60AEB1BBD8D31F65A9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (viii) La Familia Michoacana; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8AA809FE29834AB491711410C9020FD3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) any successor organization to an organization described in subparagraph (B) or as otherwise determined by the President. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFDB84FE653774D5A87E8F1FAAAF07A9D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) United states person The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">United States person means— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1B4F713EEBDF45B2B0C4943A54DE918C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) a United States citizen or an alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence to the United States; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H93080B62D1BD4270B07CF09882224104" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) an entity organized under the laws of the United States or of any jurisdiction within the United States, including a foreign branch of such an entity; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFB2B7681CE8245BD8049ECFFD490A9EB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) any person in the United States.

1705) to the same extent as a person that commits an unlawful act described in subsection (a) of that section. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0377F653295342BA81766711CBDA188A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) National security waiver The President may waive the application of sanctions under this subtitle with respect to a foreign person if the President determines that such waiver is in the national security interest of the United States. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAC0CE5F607C5454BBB88038EC8009EB4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Exceptions <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H750BB1B43D864E7493A1CBD2B53CE3E2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Exception for intelligence activities This subtitle shall not apply with respect to activities subject to the reporting requirements under title V of the National Security Act of 1947 (50 U.S.C.

or any authorized intelligence activities of the United States. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBC2F628C637C459FA6A5001B04B2004A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Exception for compliance with international obligations and law enforcement activities Sanctions under this subtitle shall not apply with respect to an alien if admitting or paroling the alien into the United States is necessary— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE86719B5F5BC4DED8DD0EA42EA0EDA5B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) to permit the United States to comply with the Agreement regarding the Headquarters of the United Nations, signed at Lake Success on June 26, 1947, and entered into force November 21, 1947, between the United Nations and the United States, or other applicable international obligations of the United States; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA2B4C0EBD9A44D5799677DC63F559C0A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) to carry out or assist law enforcement activity of the United States. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8EAC8E3EA1E7454582F405C599726A85" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Humanitarian exemption The President may not impose sanctions under this subtitle with respect to any person for conducting or facilitating a transaction for the sale of agricultural commodities, food, medicine, or medical devices or for the provision of humanitarian assistance.

TEN-YEAR STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS FOR VIOLATIONS OF SANCTIONS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5F9BDD8478654BE7BDB7AE7DBA0FBD8A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) International Emergency Economic Powers Act Section 206 of the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (50 U.S.C. 1705) is amended by adding at the end the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HE7DBBF407AC64BF88C07FBE68B84042A" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H85042BD680A34D9EB4E10B49A0BAF166" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Statute of limitations <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0C55B04240FE411DAB30A0C9E3EA1596" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Time for commencing proceedings <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBAEC7A47F9E94DC690DAC21B83A0E7EA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general An action, suit, or proceeding for the enforcement of any civil fine, penalty, or forfeiture, pecuniary or otherwise, under this section shall not be entertained unless commenced within 10 years after the latest date of the violation upon which the civil fine, penalty, or forfeiture is based. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H812496FC74854578AE025FA9684EE592" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Commencement For purposes of this paragraph, the commencement of an action, suit, or proceeding includes the issuance of a pre-penalty notice or finding of violation.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB6F1267827264610AFE538E1D1C2DBE0" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 2. DEFINITIONS In this division: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H124B732B512B4D15A9E2EB49E67C3ECF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Russian aggressor state The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Russian aggressor state means— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H745B89867EA944BB9A5AA25EF2777659" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the Russian Federation; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94AE0F000221480DB457CC0DFB84A382" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Belarus, if the President determines Belarus has engaged in an act of war against Ukraine related to Russia’s ongoing February 24, 2022, invasion of Ukraine. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9342B82E8286472F849A4B3769E881CF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Russian aggressor state sovereign asset The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Russian aggressor state sovereign asset means any Russian sovereign assets or any funds or property of another Russian aggressor state determined by the President to be of the same sovereign character as the assets described in paragraph (7).

DEFINITIONS In this division: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H124B732B512B4D15A9E2EB49E67C3ECF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Russian aggressor state The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Russian aggressor state means— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H745B89867EA944BB9A5AA25EF2777659" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the Russian Federation; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H94AE0F000221480DB457CC0DFB84A382" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Belarus, if the President determines Belarus has engaged in an act of war against Ukraine related to Russia’s ongoing February 24, 2022, invasion of Ukraine. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9342B82E8286472F849A4B3769E881CF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Russian aggressor state sovereign asset The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Russian aggressor state sovereign asset means any Russian sovereign assets or any funds or property of another Russian aggressor state determined by the President to be of the same sovereign character as the assets described in paragraph (7). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC884D35BD7DC4F8A8BC526625BDBFC47" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Appropriate congressional committees The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">appropriate congressional committees means— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAA9C730808C34068A697F45D3A6C8D18" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the Committee on Foreign Relations and the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs of the Senate; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0BA018B51B764FBE9998A97EF99D44AA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the Committee on Foreign Affairs and the Committee on Financial Services of the House of Representatives.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9342B82E8286472F849A4B3769E881CF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Russian aggressor state sovereign asset The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Russian aggressor state sovereign asset means any Russian sovereign assets or any funds or property of another Russian aggressor state determined by the President to be of the same sovereign character as the assets described in paragraph (7). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC884D35BD7DC4F8A8BC526625BDBFC47" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Appropriate congressional committees The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">appropriate congressional committees means— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAA9C730808C34068A697F45D3A6C8D18" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the Committee on Foreign Relations and the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs of the Senate; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0BA018B51B764FBE9998A97EF99D44AA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the Committee on Foreign Affairs and the Committee on Financial Services of the House of Representatives. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD4F898C7ABBD4F50914BDED943931AB8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Financial institution The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">financial institution means a financial institution specified in subparagraph (A), (B), (C), (D), (E), (F), (G), (H), (I), (J), (M), or (Z) of section 5312(a)(2) of title 31, United States Code.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7EFCB06D15BF43B6BAEA2B42816A3407" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) G7 The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">G7 means the countries that are member of the informal Group of 7, including Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom, and the United States. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2B2E0CC596E9474EB6887ACB23B40B2D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Russian sovereign asset The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Russian sovereign asset means any of the following: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBE928068768A4A889B3EC5C030BBD78C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Funds and other property of— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFC7DDB8CA67C4A14AF1E0A76E7091F21" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the Central Bank of the Russian Federation; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9F0A243EFAB1446AA685753A2AB2F224" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the Russian National Wealth Fund; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCB8BF317E8A7443981C7DDD01CFED18B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) the Ministry of Finance of the Russian Federation. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H62EF7167BA5042D38801C1819AC05C8C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Any other funds or other property that are owned by the Government of the Russian Federation, including by any subdivision, agency, or instrumentality of that government.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7EFCB06D15BF43B6BAEA2B42816A3407" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) G7 The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">G7 means the countries that are member of the informal Group of 7, including Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom, and the United States. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2B2E0CC596E9474EB6887ACB23B40B2D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Russian sovereign asset The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Russian sovereign asset means any of the following: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBE928068768A4A889B3EC5C030BBD78C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Funds and other property of— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFC7DDB8CA67C4A14AF1E0A76E7091F21" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the Central Bank of the Russian Federation; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9F0A243EFAB1446AA685753A2AB2F224" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the Russian National Wealth Fund; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCB8BF317E8A7443981C7DDD01CFED18B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) the Ministry of Finance of the Russian Federation. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H62EF7167BA5042D38801C1819AC05C8C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Any other funds or other property that are owned by the Government of the Russian Federation, including by any subdivision, agency, or instrumentality of that government.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7EFCB06D15BF43B6BAEA2B42816A3407" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) G7 The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">G7 means the countries that are member of the informal Group of 7, including Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom, and the United States. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2B2E0CC596E9474EB6887ACB23B40B2D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Russian sovereign asset The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Russian sovereign asset means any of the following: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBE928068768A4A889B3EC5C030BBD78C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Funds and other property of— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFC7DDB8CA67C4A14AF1E0A76E7091F21" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the Central Bank of the Russian Federation; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9F0A243EFAB1446AA685753A2AB2F224" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the Russian National Wealth Fund; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCB8BF317E8A7443981C7DDD01CFED18B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) the Ministry of Finance of the Russian Federation. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H62EF7167BA5042D38801C1819AC05C8C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Any other funds or other property that are owned by the Government of the Russian Federation, including by any subdivision, agency, or instrumentality of that government.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H012A653E17D2438B96C553BA545A0223" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) United states The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">United States means the several States, the District of Columbia, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, American Samoa, Guam, the United States Virgin Islands, and any other territory or possession of the United States. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCB75EEC30B5046B88BFA272A18DB34B4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) United states financial institution The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">United States financial institution means a financial institution organized under the laws of the United States or of any jurisdiction within the United States, including a foreign branch of such an institution. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD59DBF0E6A0B43F6A1695161EC1712D2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) Seize or seizure The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">seize or <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">seizure means confiscation of all right, title, and interest whatsoever in a Russian sovereign asset or a Russian aggressor state sovereign asset and vesting of the same in the United States.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0192B965931144ABB4E260C802501D6B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) The leaders of the G7 have called the Russian Federation’s <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">unprovoked and completely unjustified attack on the democratic state of Ukraine a <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">serious violation of international law and a grave breach of the United Nations Charter and all commitments Russia entered in the Helsinki Final Act and the Charter of Paris and its commitments in the Budapest Memorandum. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8074C4F091064508A04B5095C644EDFF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) On March 2, 2022, the United Nations General Assembly adopted Resolution ES–11/1, entitled <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Aggression against Ukraine, by a vote of 141 to 5. That resolution <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">deplore[d] in the strongest terms the aggression by the Russian Federation against Ukraine in violation of Article 2(4) of the [United Nations] Charter and demanded that the Russian Federation <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">immediately cease its use of force against Ukraine and <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">immediately, completely and unconditionally withdraw all of its military forces from the territory of Ukraine within its internationally recognized borders.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFCE7BD8C18F74E45AE866C1B46AEFA7D" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 102. SENSE OF CONGRESS REGARDING IMPORTANCE OF THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION PROVIDING COMPENSATION TO UKRAINE It is the sense of Congress that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC3C394F1D2D04675AE43DB76C2123E2C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the Russian Federation bears responsibility for the financial burden of the reconstruction of Ukraine and for countless other costs associated with the illegal invasion of Ukraine by the Russian Federation that began on February 24, 2022; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5717BA78E60C4E78A70FFFBD461FDC18" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the most effective ways to provide compensation for the damages caused by the Russian Federation’s internationally wrongful acts should be assessed by an international mechanism charged with determining compensation and providing assistance to Ukraine; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC349CDFA98C740F48536E10885386F8F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) at least since November 2022 the Russian Federation has been on notice of its opportunity to comply with its international obligations, including to make full compensation for injury, or, by agreement with Ukraine, to authorize an international mechanism to resolve issues regarding compensation to Ukraine; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6DB0D8585CD5482D96BA3A05612AB6E4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) the Russian Federation can, by negotiated agreement, participate in any international process to assess the damages caused by the Russian Federation’s internationally wrongful acts and make funds available to compensate for these damages, and if it fails to do so, the United States and other countries should explore all avenues for ensuring compensation to Ukraine; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2DAD1A0F5F3A49C28EE8CE2445B2883C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) the President should lead robust engagement on all bilateral and multilateral aspects of the response by the United States to acts by the Russian Federation that undermine the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, including on any policy coordination and alignment regarding the repurposing or ordered transfer of Russian sovereign assets in the context of determining compensation and providing assistance to Ukraine; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD56028FD5A264A7596BDA5DA31F0C395" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) as part of the robust engagement on bilateral and multilateral responses to acts by the Russian Federation that undermine the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, the President should endeavor to facilitate creation of, and United States participation in, an international mechanism regarding the repurposing or seizure of sovereign assets of the Russian Federation for the benefit of Ukraine. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1C1BEAFF92F6408E8A9B8D4F359EA385" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) the repurposing of Russian sovereign assets is in the national interests of the United States and consistent with United States and international law; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5B7B60BE1D1C47C680576962A6BC8F18" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) the United States should work with international allies and partners on the repurposing of Russian sovereign assets as part of a coordinated, multilateral effort, including with G7 countries and other countries in which Russian sovereign assets are located; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF454769502FC4D9497428372CCB8A96B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) any effort by the United States to confiscate and repurpose Russian sovereign assets should be undertaken alongside international allies and partners as part of a coordinated, multilateral effort, including with G7 countries, the European Union, Australia, and other countries in which Russian sovereign assets are located.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4941030C7AFC4EF2AF5D5A2610882ACF" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 104. AUTHORITY TO ENSURE COMPENSATION TO UKRAINE USING SEIZED RUSSIAN SOVEREIGN ASSETS AND RUSSIAN AGGRESSOR STATE SOVEREIGN ASSETS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2D4B23DBF5C74B648184AC9990B87AD1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Reporting on Russian assets <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0956EE60A59843F590A8146C9DA195B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Notice required Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this division, the President shall, by means of such instructions or regulations as the President may prescribe, require any financial institution at which Russian sovereign assets are located, and that knows or should know of such assets, to provide notice of such assets, including relevant information required under section 501.603(b)(ii) of title 31, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations), to the Secretary of the Treasury not later than 10 days after detection of such assets. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1D1A3E161974A49B34DE4B093787938" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Report required <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8FE02529AC1846D684986C3A0D7540EA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this division, and annually thereafter for 3 years, the President shall submit to the appropriate congressional committees a report detailing the status of Russian sovereign assets with respect to which notice has been provided to the Secretary of the Treasury under paragraph (1).

AUTHORITY TO ENSURE COMPENSATION TO UKRAINE USING SEIZED RUSSIAN SOVEREIGN ASSETS AND RUSSIAN AGGRESSOR STATE SOVEREIGN ASSETS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2D4B23DBF5C74B648184AC9990B87AD1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Reporting on Russian assets <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0956EE60A59843F590A8146C9DA195B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Notice required Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this division, the President shall, by means of such instructions or regulations as the President may prescribe, require any financial institution at which Russian sovereign assets are located, and that knows or should know of such assets, to provide notice of such assets, including relevant information required under section 501.603(b)(ii) of title 31, Code of Federal Regulations (or successor regulations), to the Secretary of the Treasury not later than 10 days after detection of such assets. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1D1A3E161974A49B34DE4B093787938" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Report required <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8FE02529AC1846D684986C3A0D7540EA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this division, and annually thereafter for 3 years, the President shall submit to the appropriate congressional committees a report detailing the status of Russian sovereign assets with respect to which notice has been provided to the Secretary of the Treasury under paragraph (1). <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA0BB5A22A2FF48F8A150CE55A1104F24" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Form The report required by subparagraph (A) shall be submitted in unclassified form, but may include a classified annex.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB1D1A3E161974A49B34DE4B093787938" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Report required <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8FE02529AC1846D684986C3A0D7540EA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this division, and annually thereafter for 3 years, the President shall submit to the appropriate congressional committees a report detailing the status of Russian sovereign assets with respect to which notice has been provided to the Secretary of the Treasury under paragraph (1). <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA0BB5A22A2FF48F8A150CE55A1104F24" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Form The report required by subparagraph (A) shall be submitted in unclassified form, but may include a classified annex. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H572946E6C07E469E813083FBE0D4EDCC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Seizure or transfer of assets <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA627FC7EB93C4240B054599D6E7C3123" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Seizure of Russian aggressor state sovereign assets On and after the date that is 30 days after the President submits to the appropriate congressional committees the certification described in subsection (c), the President may seize, confiscate, transfer, or vest any Russian aggressor state sovereign assets, in whole or in part, and including any interest or interests in such assets, subject to the jurisdiction of the United States for the purpose of transferring those funds to the Ukraine Support Fund established under subsection (d).

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA0BB5A22A2FF48F8A150CE55A1104F24" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Form The report required by subparagraph (A) shall be submitted in unclassified form, but may include a classified annex. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H572946E6C07E469E813083FBE0D4EDCC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Seizure or transfer of assets <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA627FC7EB93C4240B054599D6E7C3123" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Seizure of Russian aggressor state sovereign assets On and after the date that is 30 days after the President submits to the appropriate congressional committees the certification described in subsection (c), the President may seize, confiscate, transfer, or vest any Russian aggressor state sovereign assets, in whole or in part, and including any interest or interests in such assets, subject to the jurisdiction of the United States for the purpose of transferring those funds to the Ukraine Support Fund established under subsection (d). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7220DFBF2FED4BC3AEB51D0887A9854C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Vesting For funds confiscated under paragraph (1), all right, title, and interest shall vest in the United States Government, provided that no use of those funds other than the use of those funds consistent with subsection (f) shall be permitted.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7220DFBF2FED4BC3AEB51D0887A9854C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Vesting For funds confiscated under paragraph (1), all right, title, and interest shall vest in the United States Government, provided that no use of those funds other than the use of those funds consistent with subsection (f) shall be permitted. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD4FF165DEF34FEF9A508D0DF9A8BB36" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Liquidation and deposit The President shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCF5AEBF5585148739B1A8875112C5482" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) deposit any funds seized, transferred, or confiscated under paragraph (1) into the Ukraine Support Fund established under subsection (d); <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDE65064C74C047148DC03A2ED5A45EFD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) liquidate or sell any other property seized, transferred, or confiscated under paragraph (1) and deposit the funds resulting from such liquidation or sale into the Ukraine Support Fund; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H764A88FD025845CFBA69ABCEBAE92D25" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) make all such funds available for the purposes described in subsection (f). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFC61D09747474A639D8034ACA451DCAD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Method of seizure, transfer, or confiscation The President may seize, transfer, confiscate or vest Russian aggressor state sovereign assets under paragraph (1) through instructions or licenses or in such other manner as the President determines appropriate.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7220DFBF2FED4BC3AEB51D0887A9854C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Vesting For funds confiscated under paragraph (1), all right, title, and interest shall vest in the United States Government, provided that no use of those funds other than the use of those funds consistent with subsection (f) shall be permitted. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD4FF165DEF34FEF9A508D0DF9A8BB36" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Liquidation and deposit The President shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCF5AEBF5585148739B1A8875112C5482" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) deposit any funds seized, transferred, or confiscated under paragraph (1) into the Ukraine Support Fund established under subsection (d); <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDE65064C74C047148DC03A2ED5A45EFD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) liquidate or sell any other property seized, transferred, or confiscated under paragraph (1) and deposit the funds resulting from such liquidation or sale into the Ukraine Support Fund; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H764A88FD025845CFBA69ABCEBAE92D25" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) make all such funds available for the purposes described in subsection (f). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFC61D09747474A639D8034ACA451DCAD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Method of seizure, transfer, or confiscation The President may seize, transfer, confiscate or vest Russian aggressor state sovereign assets under paragraph (1) through instructions or licenses or in such other manner as the President determines appropriate.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7220DFBF2FED4BC3AEB51D0887A9854C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Vesting For funds confiscated under paragraph (1), all right, title, and interest shall vest in the United States Government, provided that no use of those funds other than the use of those funds consistent with subsection (f) shall be permitted. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDD4FF165DEF34FEF9A508D0DF9A8BB36" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Liquidation and deposit The President shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCF5AEBF5585148739B1A8875112C5482" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) deposit any funds seized, transferred, or confiscated under paragraph (1) into the Ukraine Support Fund established under subsection (d); <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDE65064C74C047148DC03A2ED5A45EFD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) liquidate or sell any other property seized, transferred, or confiscated under paragraph (1) and deposit the funds resulting from such liquidation or sale into the Ukraine Support Fund; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H764A88FD025845CFBA69ABCEBAE92D25" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) make all such funds available for the purposes described in subsection (f). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFC61D09747474A639D8034ACA451DCAD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Method of seizure, transfer, or confiscation The President may seize, transfer, confiscate or vest Russian aggressor state sovereign assets under paragraph (1) through instructions or licenses or in such other manner as the President determines appropriate.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFC61D09747474A639D8034ACA451DCAD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Method of seizure, transfer, or confiscation The President may seize, transfer, confiscate or vest Russian aggressor state sovereign assets under paragraph (1) through instructions or licenses or in such other manner as the President determines appropriate. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3F8448DB29C244B999F870D99C3A5B48" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Certification The certification described in this subsection, with respect to Russian aggressor state sovereign assets, is a certification that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H53B6CA728F43402B92ECD69002BFACAF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) seizing, confiscating, transferring, or vesting Russian aggressor state sovereign assets for the benefit of Ukraine is in the national interests of the United States; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1CEEBD1122A145BBA08BB6F4AC62C9F2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the President has meaningfully coordinated with G7 leaders to take multilateral action with regard to any seizure, confiscation, vesting, or transfer of Russian sovereign assets for the benefit of Ukraine; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA6CD2FCC9E884F4982E8043A7D8F4910" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) either— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H414C3C2815DB4809BFDBE99A017EFE72" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the President has received an official and legitimate request from a properly constituted international mechanism that includes the participation of the Government of Ukraine and the United States and that has been established for the purpose of, or otherwise tasked with, compensating Ukraine for damages arising or resulting from the internationally wrongful acts of the Russian Federation regarding the repurposing of sovereign assets of the Russian Federation; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0E4DC6B855294EE8A658D5ECE2826039" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) either— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3667E39F3FDA42DD9B198648B6329252" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the Russian Federation has not ceased its unlawful aggression against Ukraine; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H15943237B5774C45BBE2F89714483A88" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the Russian Federation has ceased its unlawful aggression against Ukraine, but— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6DF4FD387A564597A48056F3F2429BFC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) has not provided full compensation to Ukraine for harms resulting from the internationally wrongful acts of the Russian Federation; and <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD21303413F42433E95640582E951BEE6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) is not participating in a bona fide process to provide full compensation to Ukraine for harms resulting from Russian aggression. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5DEE309B6059425EBAA2366B2DBE796E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Establishment of the Ukraine Support Fund <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H490689BF96EC4D75B3451A2B09FF0993" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Ukraine support fund The President shall establish an account, to be known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Ukraine Support Fund, to consist of any funds with respect to which a seizure is ordered pursuant to subsection (b).

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFC61D09747474A639D8034ACA451DCAD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Method of seizure, transfer, or confiscation The President may seize, transfer, confiscate or vest Russian aggressor state sovereign assets under paragraph (1) through instructions or licenses or in such other manner as the President determines appropriate. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3F8448DB29C244B999F870D99C3A5B48" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Certification The certification described in this subsection, with respect to Russian aggressor state sovereign assets, is a certification that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H53B6CA728F43402B92ECD69002BFACAF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) seizing, confiscating, transferring, or vesting Russian aggressor state sovereign assets for the benefit of Ukraine is in the national interests of the United States; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1CEEBD1122A145BBA08BB6F4AC62C9F2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the President has meaningfully coordinated with G7 leaders to take multilateral action with regard to any seizure, confiscation, vesting, or transfer of Russian sovereign assets for the benefit of Ukraine; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA6CD2FCC9E884F4982E8043A7D8F4910" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) either— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H414C3C2815DB4809BFDBE99A017EFE72" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the President has received an official and legitimate request from a properly constituted international mechanism that includes the participation of the Government of Ukraine and the United States and that has been established for the purpose of, or otherwise tasked with, compensating Ukraine for damages arising or resulting from the internationally wrongful acts of the Russian Federation regarding the repurposing of sovereign assets of the Russian Federation; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0E4DC6B855294EE8A658D5ECE2826039" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) either— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3667E39F3FDA42DD9B198648B6329252" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the Russian Federation has not ceased its unlawful aggression against Ukraine; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H15943237B5774C45BBE2F89714483A88" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the Russian Federation has ceased its unlawful aggression against Ukraine, but— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6DF4FD387A564597A48056F3F2429BFC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) has not provided full compensation to Ukraine for harms resulting from the internationally wrongful acts of the Russian Federation; and <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD21303413F42433E95640582E951BEE6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) is not participating in a bona fide process to provide full compensation to Ukraine for harms resulting from Russian aggression. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5DEE309B6059425EBAA2366B2DBE796E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Establishment of the Ukraine Support Fund <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H490689BF96EC4D75B3451A2B09FF0993" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Ukraine support fund The President shall establish an account, to be known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Ukraine Support Fund, to consist of any funds with respect to which a seizure is ordered pursuant to subsection (b).

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFC61D09747474A639D8034ACA451DCAD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Method of seizure, transfer, or confiscation The President may seize, transfer, confiscate or vest Russian aggressor state sovereign assets under paragraph (1) through instructions or licenses or in such other manner as the President determines appropriate. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3F8448DB29C244B999F870D99C3A5B48" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Certification The certification described in this subsection, with respect to Russian aggressor state sovereign assets, is a certification that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H53B6CA728F43402B92ECD69002BFACAF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) seizing, confiscating, transferring, or vesting Russian aggressor state sovereign assets for the benefit of Ukraine is in the national interests of the United States; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1CEEBD1122A145BBA08BB6F4AC62C9F2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the President has meaningfully coordinated with G7 leaders to take multilateral action with regard to any seizure, confiscation, vesting, or transfer of Russian sovereign assets for the benefit of Ukraine; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA6CD2FCC9E884F4982E8043A7D8F4910" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) either— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H414C3C2815DB4809BFDBE99A017EFE72" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the President has received an official and legitimate request from a properly constituted international mechanism that includes the participation of the Government of Ukraine and the United States and that has been established for the purpose of, or otherwise tasked with, compensating Ukraine for damages arising or resulting from the internationally wrongful acts of the Russian Federation regarding the repurposing of sovereign assets of the Russian Federation; or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0E4DC6B855294EE8A658D5ECE2826039" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) either— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3667E39F3FDA42DD9B198648B6329252" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the Russian Federation has not ceased its unlawful aggression against Ukraine; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H15943237B5774C45BBE2F89714483A88" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the Russian Federation has ceased its unlawful aggression against Ukraine, but— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6DF4FD387A564597A48056F3F2429BFC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) has not provided full compensation to Ukraine for harms resulting from the internationally wrongful acts of the Russian Federation;
