<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5DEE309B6059425EBAA2366B2DBE796E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Establishment of the Ukraine Support Fund <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H490689BF96EC4D75B3451A2B09FF0993" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Ukraine support fund The President shall establish an account, to be known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Ukraine Support Fund, to consist of any funds with respect to which a seizure is ordered pursuant to subsection (b). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H09DF8088E29046C6B425EE046D4B7834" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Use of funds The funds in the accounts established under paragraph (1) shall be available to be used only as specified in subsection (f). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H39B0C38CA87747ADBC48EC40B3C22180" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Rule of construction Nothing in this section may be construed to provide the President with the authority to seize, transfer, confiscate, or vest title to foreign sovereign assets that are not Russian aggressor state sovereign assets in the United States or transfer any foreign sovereign assets to any recipient for any use other than the uses described in this division.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H39B0C38CA87747ADBC48EC40B3C22180" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Rule of construction Nothing in this section may be construed to provide the President with the authority to seize, transfer, confiscate, or vest title to foreign sovereign assets that are not Russian aggressor state sovereign assets in the United States or transfer any foreign sovereign assets to any recipient for any use other than the uses described in this division. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9D6068A2A71C4D1BA4664C1BAA12BC44" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) Further transfer and use of funds <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0DEDC18DB1A456E95297FC44147FC5F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Subject to paragraphs (2) and (3), Funds in the Ukraine Support Fund shall be available to the Secretary of State, in consultation with the Administrator of the United States Agency for International Development, for the purpose of providing assistance to Ukraine for the damage resulting from the unlawful invasion by the Russian Federation that began on February 24, 2022. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD152001257CF426193648A875DAF538E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Specific permissible uses Subject to paragraph (3), the following are permissible uses of the funds in the Ukraine Support Fund pursuant to paragraph (1): <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5085B53C42C9422C8389CC00030745B1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Making contributions to an international body, fund, or mechanism established consistent with section 105(a) that is charged with determining and administering compensation or providing assistance to Ukraine.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9D6068A2A71C4D1BA4664C1BAA12BC44" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) Further transfer and use of funds <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0DEDC18DB1A456E95297FC44147FC5F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Subject to paragraphs (2) and (3), Funds in the Ukraine Support Fund shall be available to the Secretary of State, in consultation with the Administrator of the United States Agency for International Development, for the purpose of providing assistance to Ukraine for the damage resulting from the unlawful invasion by the Russian Federation that began on February 24, 2022. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD152001257CF426193648A875DAF538E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Specific permissible uses Subject to paragraph (3), the following are permissible uses of the funds in the Ukraine Support Fund pursuant to paragraph (1): <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5085B53C42C9422C8389CC00030745B1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Making contributions to an international body, fund, or mechanism established consistent with section 105(a) that is charged with determining and administering compensation or providing assistance to Ukraine. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H306AA71D3FA341AC8F5EBF230177B750" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Supporting reconstruction, rebuilding, and recovery efforts in Ukraine.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9D6068A2A71C4D1BA4664C1BAA12BC44" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) Further transfer and use of funds <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0DEDC18DB1A456E95297FC44147FC5F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Subject to paragraphs (2) and (3), Funds in the Ukraine Support Fund shall be available to the Secretary of State, in consultation with the Administrator of the United States Agency for International Development, for the purpose of providing assistance to Ukraine for the damage resulting from the unlawful invasion by the Russian Federation that began on February 24, 2022. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD152001257CF426193648A875DAF538E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Specific permissible uses Subject to paragraph (3), the following are permissible uses of the funds in the Ukraine Support Fund pursuant to paragraph (1): <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5085B53C42C9422C8389CC00030745B1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Making contributions to an international body, fund, or mechanism established consistent with section 105(a) that is charged with determining and administering compensation or providing assistance to Ukraine. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H306AA71D3FA341AC8F5EBF230177B750" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Supporting reconstruction, rebuilding, and recovery efforts in Ukraine.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9D6068A2A71C4D1BA4664C1BAA12BC44" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) Further transfer and use of funds <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0DEDC18DB1A456E95297FC44147FC5F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Subject to paragraphs (2) and (3), Funds in the Ukraine Support Fund shall be available to the Secretary of State, in consultation with the Administrator of the United States Agency for International Development, for the purpose of providing assistance to Ukraine for the damage resulting from the unlawful invasion by the Russian Federation that began on February 24, 2022. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD152001257CF426193648A875DAF538E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Specific permissible uses Subject to paragraph (3), the following are permissible uses of the funds in the Ukraine Support Fund pursuant to paragraph (1): <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5085B53C42C9422C8389CC00030745B1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Making contributions to an international body, fund, or mechanism established consistent with section 105(a) that is charged with determining and administering compensation or providing assistance to Ukraine. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H306AA71D3FA341AC8F5EBF230177B750" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Supporting reconstruction, rebuilding, and recovery efforts in Ukraine.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1DDB4821608044F58F0C3A3D40F51620" qb-display-quote="yes"> (h) Joint resolution of disapproval No funds may be transferred pursuant to subsection (f) if, within 15 days of receipt of the notification required under subsection (f)(3), a joint resolution is enacted into law prohibiting such transfer. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1DFF4D66C0CE4D3D8495AC031E650746" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Report Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this division, and not less frequently than every 180 days thereafter, the President shall submit to the appropriate congressional committees a report that includes the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H92BE0062208D40A097AC64624469B10E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) An accounting of funds in the Ukraine Support Fund. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1860C68FD6FA4CE5A8285D77120D90F9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Any information regarding the disposition of funds in any account to which funds have been transferred pursuant to subsection (f) that has been transmitted to the President by the institution housing said account during the period covered by the report.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1860C68FD6FA4CE5A8285D77120D90F9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Any information regarding the disposition of funds in any account to which funds have been transferred pursuant to subsection (f) that has been transmitted to the President by the institution housing said account during the period covered by the report. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H77B4A298A6C347BFA6B27FA0681C6E3C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) A description of United States multilateral and bilateral diplomatic engagement with allies and partners of the United States that also have immobilized Russian sovereign assets to compensate for damages caused by the Russian Federation’s internationally wrongful acts during the period covered by the report. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23DB7BEC9D104220B08C52D2D7233AC8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) An outline of steps taken to carry out the establishment of the international mechanism described by section 105(a) during the period covered by the report.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H23DB7BEC9D104220B08C52D2D7233AC8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) An outline of steps taken to carry out the establishment of the international mechanism described by section 105(a) during the period covered by the report. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H955328A9251D4196AFCFADCE507EB309" qb-display-quote="yes"> (j) Exception for united states obligations under treaties The authorities provided by this section may not be exercised in a manner inconsistent with the obligations of the United States under— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB4FA34C5FC314F2D8B0A8997502AE8FD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the Convention on Diplomatic Relations, done at Vienna April 18, 1961, and entered into force April 24, 1964 (23 UST 3227); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB9AF75A164FC4D53A58A281319221FBC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the Convention on Consular Relations, done at Vienna April 24, 1963, and entered into force on March 19, 1967 (21 UST 77); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H11BE0338178047A09BA3A8CC944D7FE4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the Agreement Regarding the Headquarters of the United Nations, signed at Lake Success June 26, 1947, and entered into force November 21, 1947 (TIAS 1676); or <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H35836B34869F4D91B7A31A080BAB1189" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) any other international agreement to which the United States is a state party on the day before the date of the enactment of this division. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC57832DDE44F4580B75E654720110D26" qb-display-quote="yes"> (k) Judicial review <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3C2DB1EBBF1A44DD82A800AB6724B1F1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Exclusiveness of remedy Notwithstanding any other provision of law, any action taken under this section shall not be subject to judicial review, except as provided in this subsection.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H955328A9251D4196AFCFADCE507EB309" qb-display-quote="yes"> (j) Exception for united states obligations under treaties The authorities provided by this section may not be exercised in a manner inconsistent with the obligations of the United States under— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB4FA34C5FC314F2D8B0A8997502AE8FD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the Convention on Diplomatic Relations, done at Vienna April 18, 1961, and entered into force April 24, 1964 (23 UST 3227); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB9AF75A164FC4D53A58A281319221FBC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the Convention on Consular Relations, done at Vienna April 24, 1963, and entered into force on March 19, 1967 (21 UST 77); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H11BE0338178047A09BA3A8CC944D7FE4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the Agreement Regarding the Headquarters of the United Nations, signed at Lake Success June 26, 1947, and entered into force November 21, 1947 (TIAS 1676); or <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H35836B34869F4D91B7A31A080BAB1189" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) any other international agreement to which the United States is a state party on the day before the date of the enactment of this division. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC57832DDE44F4580B75E654720110D26" qb-display-quote="yes"> (k) Judicial review <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3C2DB1EBBF1A44DD82A800AB6724B1F1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Exclusiveness of remedy Notwithstanding any other provision of law, any action taken under this section shall not be subject to judicial review, except as provided in this subsection. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H59D06786634940019DAE951998113927" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Limitations for filing claims A claim may only be brought with respect to an action under this section— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H33A71523702D401D8B8DC24F7C70ECA3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) that alleges that the action will deny rights under the Constitution of the United States; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8230520143DA4A908E19EAAF52BDACC7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) if the claim is brought not later than 60 days after the date of such action.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC44BED194BE6401FA9E7F8F1E494BA9F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Expedited consideration It shall be the duty of the United States District Court for the District of Columbia and the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit to advance on the docket and to expedite to the greatest possible extent the disposition of any claim brought under this subsection. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB98A2ADFA5E943839984CA347E898EAE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (l) Sunset The authorities conferred under this section shall terminate on the earlier of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02C06611CDDF447992E1F655D51005CE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the date that is 5 years after the date of the enactment of this division; or <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC15EC74DCD3441EE8EEFD47B7A1B4C53" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the date that is 120 days after the date on which the President determines and certifies to the appropriate congressional committees that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H96C10FE7386043FF9BA1466A6C2874BD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the Russian Federation has reached an agreement relating to the respective withdrawal of Russian forces and cessation of military hostilities that is accepted by the free and independent Government of Ukraine; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1D8C955C3D794C3F934ECA4621380CF1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2FE6C98C0AB549348490844EF3426444" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) full compensation has been made to Ukraine for harms resulting from the invasion of Ukraine by the Russian Federation; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC9E27EE4699A4A3EB5C77144424EB299" indent="subparagraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the Russian Federation is participating in a bona fide international mechanism that, by agreement, will discharge the obligations of the Russian Federation to compensate Ukraine for all amounts determined to be owed to Ukraine; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5E238156DF7B4794B4F11F37C74ECE4D" indent="subparagraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) the Russian Federation’s obligation to compensate Ukraine for the damage caused by the Russian Federation’s aggression has been resolved pursuant to an agreement between the Russian Federation and the Government of Ukraine. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H70A234DB1BF94EAF94978E90C4584C32" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 105. INTERNATIONAL MECHANISM TO USE RUSSIAN SOVEREIGN ASSETS AND RUSSIAN AGGRESSOR STATE SOVEREIGN ASSETS TO PROVIDE FOR THE RECONSTRUCTION OF UKRAINE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H66BCF0E9D1FC4FFDB02439AD6C2CE1F6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general The President shall take such actions as the President determines appropriate to coordinate with the G7, the European Union, Australia, and other partners and allies of the United States regarding the disposition of immobilized Russian aggressor state sovereign assets, including seeking to establish an international mechanism with foreign partners, including Ukraine, the G7, the European Union, Australia, and other partners and allies of the United States, for the purpose of assisting Ukraine, which may include the establishment of an international fund to be known as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">Ukraine Compensation Fund, that may receive and use assets in the Ukraine Support Fund established under section 104(c) and contributions from foreign partners that have also frozen or seized Russian aggressor state sovereign assets to assist Ukraine, including by— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H78A825C0203F43209366E422BB57D381" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) supporting a register of damage to serve as a record of evidence and for assessment of the financially assessable damages to Ukraine resulting from the invasions of Ukraine by the Russian Federation and operations or actions in support thereof; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC960C1F9995C405299C3388A70277795" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) establishing a mechanism to compensate Ukraine for damages caused by Russia’s internationally wrongful acts connected with the invasions of Ukraine; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB5ECE83801ED4FEB9DA1220BC21B6B60" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) ensuring distribution of those assets or the proceeds of those assets based on determinations under that mechanism; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H919178C89C7849E4992298A87308E88F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) taking such other actions as may be necessary to carry out this section.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB98A2ADFA5E943839984CA347E898EAE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (l) Sunset The authorities conferred under this section shall terminate on the earlier of— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02C06611CDDF447992E1F655D51005CE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the date that is 5 years after the date of the enactment of this division; or <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC15EC74DCD3441EE8EEFD47B7A1B4C53" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the date that is 120 days after the date on which the President determines and certifies to the appropriate congressional committees that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H96C10FE7386043FF9BA1466A6C2874BD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the Russian Federation has reached an agreement relating to the respective withdrawal of Russian forces and cessation of military hostilities that is accepted by the free and independent Government of Ukraine; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1D8C955C3D794C3F934ECA4621380CF1" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2FE6C98C0AB549348490844EF3426444" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) full compensation has been made to Ukraine for harms resulting from the invasion of Ukraine by the Russian Federation; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC9E27EE4699A4A3EB5C77144424EB299" indent="subparagraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the Russian Federation is participating in a bona fide international mechanism that, by agreement, will discharge the obligations of the Russian Federation to compensate Ukraine for all amounts determined to be owed to Ukraine; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5E238156DF7B4794B4F11F37C74ECE4D" indent="subparagraph" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) the Russian Federation’s obligation to compensate Ukraine for the damage caused by the Russian Federation’s aggression has been resolved pursuant to an agreement between the Russian Federation and the Government of Ukraine. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H70A234DB1BF94EAF94978E90C4584C32" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 105. and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H919178C89C7849E4992298A87308E88F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) taking such other actions as may be necessary to carry out this section. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H363FB384FCCC4CE2900ABC0DBFAE43B5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Authorization for deposit in the Ukraine Compensation Fund Upon the President reaching an agreement or arrangement to establish a common international mechanism pursuant to subsection (a) or at any time thereafter, the Secretary of State may, pursuant to the authority conferred by and subject to the limitations described in section 104(f) and subject to the limitations described in subsection (e), transfer funds from the Ukraine Support Fund established under section 104(d) to a fund or mechanism established consistent with subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5D7BFE98BF4E447EB110ABDDFDBFE235" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Notification The President shall notify the appropriate congressional committees not later than 30 days after entering into any new bilateral or multilateral agreement or arrangement under subsection (a).

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H363FB384FCCC4CE2900ABC0DBFAE43B5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Authorization for deposit in the Ukraine Compensation Fund Upon the President reaching an agreement or arrangement to establish a common international mechanism pursuant to subsection (a) or at any time thereafter, the Secretary of State may, pursuant to the authority conferred by and subject to the limitations described in section 104(f) and subject to the limitations described in subsection (e), transfer funds from the Ukraine Support Fund established under section 104(d) to a fund or mechanism established consistent with subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5D7BFE98BF4E447EB110ABDDFDBFE235" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Notification The President shall notify the appropriate congressional committees not later than 30 days after entering into any new bilateral or multilateral agreement or arrangement under subsection (a). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC711994E03574FF2B34FABAB0AB809A6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Good governance The Secretary of State, in consultation with the Secretary of the Treasury, shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4CD4A4C0F778455CA0078F399F675290" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) seek to ensure that any fund or mechanism established consistent with subsection (a) operates in accordance with established international accounting principles; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4E6E4F3DF32247D09C4DE5DA1FF9B6D7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) seek to ensure that any fund or mechanism established consistent with subsection (a) is— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H09A829E87AC24C628A759EB193E744B9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) staffed, operated, and administered in accordance with established accounting rules and governance procedures, including providing for payment of reasonable expenses from the fund for the governance and operation of the fund and the tribunal; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB378F487A5C24DB5A06AC455522BC8CE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) operated transparently as to all funds transfers, filings, and decisions; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB7977CF808E542B5BDBF8F7C47FB2181" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) audited on a regular basis by an independent auditor, in accordance with internationally accepted accounting and auditing standards; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H71D19AB20D394BFE96F3E164516853F8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) seek to ensure that any audits of any fund or mechanism established consistent with subsection (a) shall be made available to the public; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H245F3CDE032A4E158B2F4E988DFDE4AE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) ensure that any audits of any fund or mechanism established consistent with subsection (a) shall be reviewed and reported on by the Government Accountability Office to the appropriate congressional committees and the public.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC711994E03574FF2B34FABAB0AB809A6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Good governance The Secretary of State, in consultation with the Secretary of the Treasury, shall— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4CD4A4C0F778455CA0078F399F675290" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) seek to ensure that any fund or mechanism established consistent with subsection (a) operates in accordance with established international accounting principles; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4E6E4F3DF32247D09C4DE5DA1FF9B6D7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) seek to ensure that any fund or mechanism established consistent with subsection (a) is— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H09A829E87AC24C628A759EB193E744B9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) staffed, operated, and administered in accordance with established accounting rules and governance procedures, including providing for payment of reasonable expenses from the fund for the governance and operation of the fund and the tribunal; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB378F487A5C24DB5A06AC455522BC8CE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) operated transparently as to all funds transfers, filings, and decisions; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB7977CF808E542B5BDBF8F7C47FB2181" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) audited on a regular basis by an independent auditor, in accordance with internationally accepted accounting and auditing standards; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H71D19AB20D394BFE96F3E164516853F8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) seek to ensure that any audits of any fund or mechanism established consistent with subsection (a) shall be made available to the public; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H245F3CDE032A4E158B2F4E988DFDE4AE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) ensure that any audits of any fund or mechanism established consistent with subsection (a) shall be reviewed and reported on by the Government Accountability Office to the appropriate congressional committees and the public. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0B054A2185DA44F4876FF1DBBDF25467" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Limitation on transfer of funds No funds may be transferred from the Ukraine Support Fund to a fund or mechanism established consistent with subsection (a) unless the President certifies to the appropriate congressional committees that— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H00DB1632172E403C9702FEBAE6A188DA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the institution housing the fund or mechanism has a plan to ensure transparency and accountability for all funds transferred to and from the fund or mechanism established consistent with subsection (a); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7BB695B552A64B6ABFE35970DFB65A28" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the President has transmitted the plan required under paragraph (1) to the appropriate congressional committees in writing. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H256AB529597A445BB53661B30170C3AE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (f) Joint resolution of disapproval No funds may be transferred from the Ukraine Support Fund to a fund or mechanism established consistent with subsection (a) if, within 30 days of receipt of the notification required under subsection (c)(2), a joint resolution is enacted prohibiting the transfer.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBAFCC81D5331426E8A38D09B97B34FB0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (g) Report Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this division, and not less frequently than every 90 days thereafter, the President shall submit to the appropriate congressional committees a report that includes the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE76BA8C3E2044819ABD935F585492085" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) An accounting of funds in any fund or mechanism established consistent with subsection (a). <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H862FA19CAE274AA3903BA37CC0EC14E7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Any information regarding the disposition of any such fund or mechanism that has been transmitted to the President by the institution housing the fund or mechanism during the period covered by the report. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74F4C899FFAD42D1AF6DED7031AC0E15" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) A description of United States multilateral and bilateral diplomatic engagement with allies and partners of the United States that also have immobilized Russian sovereign assets to allow for compensation for Ukraine during the period covered by the report.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H862FA19CAE274AA3903BA37CC0EC14E7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Any information regarding the disposition of any such fund or mechanism that has been transmitted to the President by the institution housing the fund or mechanism during the period covered by the report. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H74F4C899FFAD42D1AF6DED7031AC0E15" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) A description of United States multilateral and bilateral diplomatic engagement with allies and partners of the United States that also have immobilized Russian sovereign assets to allow for compensation for Ukraine during the period covered by the report. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3AF03B7F0361440CA408D4D0F39C00AC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) An outline of steps taken to carry out this section during the period covered by the report.

ASSESSMENT BY SECRETARY OF STATE AND ADMINISTRATOR OF USAID ON RECONSTRUCTION AND REBUILDING NEEDS OF UKRAINE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6AA2EB3808F14A8E9D80BF91399EE9B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this division, the Secretary of State, in consultation with the Administrator of the United States Agency for International Development, shall submit to the appropriate congressional committees an assessment of the most pressing needs of Ukraine for reconstruction, rebuilding, and humanitarian aid. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC763D672D52D4C6898F11A49C0A1C0C5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The assessment required by subsection (a) shall include the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA2F0677225414D58B4D2B24A16301148" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) An estimate of the rebuilding and reconstruction needs of Ukraine, as of the date of the assessment, resulting from the unlawful invasion of Ukraine by the Russian Federation, including— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24EFEA6A314644BCBD92492F7B0E6576" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) a description of the sources and methods for the estimate; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCFB73AA6ABC44AD3A3A4157E494C8461" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) an identification of the locations or regions in Ukraine with the most pressing needs. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA0EF175BC6814B44B73C26E390B53D36" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) An estimate of the humanitarian needs, as of the date of the assessment, of the people of Ukraine, including Ukrainians residing inside the internationally recognized borders of Ukraine or outside those borders, resulting from the unlawful invasion of Ukraine by the Russian Federation.

ASSESSMENT BY SECRETARY OF STATE AND ADMINISTRATOR OF USAID ON RECONSTRUCTION AND REBUILDING NEEDS OF UKRAINE <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6AA2EB3808F14A8E9D80BF91399EE9B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this division, the Secretary of State, in consultation with the Administrator of the United States Agency for International Development, shall submit to the appropriate congressional committees an assessment of the most pressing needs of Ukraine for reconstruction, rebuilding, and humanitarian aid. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC763D672D52D4C6898F11A49C0A1C0C5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Elements The assessment required by subsection (a) shall include the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA2F0677225414D58B4D2B24A16301148" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) An estimate of the rebuilding and reconstruction needs of Ukraine, as of the date of the assessment, resulting from the unlawful invasion of Ukraine by the Russian Federation, including— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24EFEA6A314644BCBD92492F7B0E6576" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) a description of the sources and methods for the estimate; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCFB73AA6ABC44AD3A3A4157E494C8461" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) an identification of the locations or regions in Ukraine with the most pressing needs. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA0EF175BC6814B44B73C26E390B53D36" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) An estimate of the humanitarian needs, as of the date of the assessment, of the people of Ukraine, including Ukrainians residing inside the internationally recognized borders of Ukraine or outside those borders, resulting from the unlawful invasion of Ukraine by the Russian Federation.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8288A2FF69B74B388792F1C96FA20BDF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) An assessment of the extent to which the needs described in paragraphs (1) and (2) have been met or funded, by any source, as of the date of the assessment. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H068FBFB633224E5BA1BA740AEFEE1BE2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) A plan to engage in robust multilateral and bilateral diplomacy to ensure that allies and partners of the United States, particularly in the European Union as Ukraine seeks accession to the European Union, increase their commitment to Ukraine’s reconstruction. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H30EFEC941B70400C8D674A045C0F6962" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) An identification of which such needs should be prioritized, including any assessment or request by the Government of Ukraine with respect to the prioritization of such needs.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB88A893B1FD2454C9B45A14D61E71C04" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Imposition of sanctions The President may impose the sanctions authorized by the applicable provision of law listed in subsection (a)(2) with respect to each foreign person identified in the report required under subsection (a)(1) who is not already subject to sanctions under United States law pursuant to one or more statutory sanctions authorities as of the date of the submission of such report. <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE2029BEDE8AB4D1AB1C95FDCCCDFDFA5" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 2. INCLUSION OF INFORMATION ON EMERGING TECHNOLOGICAL DEVELOPMENTS IN ANNUAL CHINA MILITARY POWER REPORT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD30EB3F73F094C228518EE566468D028" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general As part of each annual report submitted under section 1202 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2000 (Public Law 106–65; 10 U.S.C.

INCLUSION OF INFORMATION ON EMERGING TECHNOLOGICAL DEVELOPMENTS IN ANNUAL CHINA MILITARY POWER REPORT <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD30EB3F73F094C228518EE566468D028" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general As part of each annual report submitted under section 1202 of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2000 (Public Law 106–65; 10 U.S.C. 113 note)(commonly referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">China Military Power report), the Secretary of Defense and Secretary of State, in consultation with the heads of such other Federal departments and agencies as the Secretary of Defense and Secretary of State may determine appropriate, shall include a component on emerging technological developments involving the People’s Republic of China. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1EB1836E001D4A7C894AA01F9E4607C4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Matters Each report component referred to in subsection (a) shall include an identification and assessment of at least five fields of critical or emerging technologies in which the People’s Liberation Army is invested, or for which there are Military-Civil Fusion Development Strategy programs of the People’s Republic of China, including the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H32711CDC1F104309BC8AB40F2EE8181E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) A brief summary of each such identified field and its relevance to the military power and national security of the People’s Republic of China.

113 note)(commonly referred to as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">China Military Power report), the Secretary of Defense and Secretary of State, in consultation with the heads of such other Federal departments and agencies as the Secretary of Defense and Secretary of State may determine appropriate, shall include a component on emerging technological developments involving the People’s Republic of China. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1EB1836E001D4A7C894AA01F9E4607C4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Matters Each report component referred to in subsection (a) shall include an identification and assessment of at least five fields of critical or emerging technologies in which the People’s Liberation Army is invested, or for which there are Military-Civil Fusion Development Strategy programs of the People’s Republic of China, including the following: <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H32711CDC1F104309BC8AB40F2EE8181E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) A brief summary of each such identified field and its relevance to the military power and national security of the People’s Republic of China. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4065BA9D58024759ADEA660A585A66EF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) The implications for the national security of the United States as a result of the leadership or dominance by the People’s Republic of China in each such identified field and associated supply chains.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2986533332AE4267A78FC30363652059" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) The identification of at least 10 entities domiciled in, controlled by, or directed by the People’s Republic of China (including any subsidiaries of such entity), involved in each such identified field, and an assessment of, with respect to each such entity, the following: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA664657E20264547ADD65EB3D649745A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Whether the entity has procured components from any known United States suppliers. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA87A1F5916F6462D945A2AA252833C69" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Whether any United States technology imported by the entity is controlled under United States regulations. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H316797A4D6F5435CBDDBF5E7D6887CC7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Whether United States capital is invested in the entity, either through known direct investment or passive investment flows.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H316797A4D6F5435CBDDBF5E7D6887CC7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Whether United States capital is invested in the entity, either through known direct investment or passive investment flows. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC7C65C152A124E7581A2BE87D8F6F463" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) Whether the entity has any connection to the People’s Liberation Army, the Military-Civil Fusion program of the People’s Republic of China, or any other state-sponsored initiatives of the People’s Republic of China to support the development of national champions. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF75036A658AF49C5910F787BFC828698" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Appropriate congressional committees defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">appropriate congressional committees means— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H432890CDB84645EBA2F2E974AC21E985" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the Committee on Foreign Affairs of the House of Representatives; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H14661860844A4E8BA94E9A262F03B11C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the Committee on Armed Services of the House of Representatives; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8F342B632DD1489099970C5BCB92E4EB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the Committee on Foreign Relations of the Senate; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF5E8313F92B4B47B3F9E2542C7499B3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) the Committee on Armed Services of the Senate.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF75036A658AF49C5910F787BFC828698" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Appropriate congressional committees defined In this section, the term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">appropriate congressional committees means— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H432890CDB84645EBA2F2E974AC21E985" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) the Committee on Foreign Affairs of the House of Representatives; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H14661860844A4E8BA94E9A262F03B11C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) the Committee on Armed Services of the House of Representatives; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8F342B632DD1489099970C5BCB92E4EB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) the Committee on Foreign Relations of the Senate; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAF5E8313F92B4B47B3F9E2542C7499B3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) the Committee on Armed Services of the Senate. H Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAB71148D0F3D490CAADB3AD0AF49921C" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 1. SHORT TITLE This division may be cited as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text"> Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act .

H Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAB71148D0F3D490CAADB3AD0AF49921C" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 1. SHORT TITLE This division may be cited as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text"> Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act . <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB72D71B2E6EA4286949A14E8B4253224" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 2.

SHORT TITLE This division may be cited as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text"> Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act . <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB72D71B2E6EA4286949A14E8B4253224" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 2. PROHIBITION OF FOREIGN ADVERSARY CONTROLLED APPLICATIONS <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H052BF57E9C8746E7A1B93A2B38E1396A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) In general <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H58B63000DC234D6F8EF4477EFE07D700" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Prohibition of foreign adversary controlled applications It shall be unlawful for an entity to distribute, maintain, or update (or enable the distribution, maintenance, or updating of) a foreign adversary controlled application by carrying out, within the land or maritime borders of the United States, any of the following: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC812013EFF46487F958F2ACA797181E0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Providing services to distribute, maintain, or update such foreign adversary controlled application (including any source code of such application) by means of a marketplace (including an online mobile application store) through which users within the land or maritime borders of the United States may access, maintain, or update such application.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9574CC1E76A845E08021EACA09E0BE1E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Providing internet hosting services to enable the distribution, maintenance, or updating of such foreign adversary controlled application for users within the land or maritime borders of the United States. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5E38C02E012E4FB5A5CCF1573A786032" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Applicability Subject to paragraph (3), this subsection shall apply— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H636689BA78CF41E1BCDBDC65506A015B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) in the case of an application that satisfies the definition of a foreign adversary controlled application pursuant to subsection (g)(3)(A), beginning on the date that is 270 days after the date of the enactment of this division; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24E3290075414FC08C3855C9FD84A471" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) in the case of an application that satisfies the definition of a foreign adversary controlled application pursuant to subsection (g)(3)(B), beginning on the date that is 270 days after the date of the relevant determination of the President under such subsection. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H22D8E2C85C144E68BDA42909FF197DB3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Extension With respect to a foreign adversary controlled application, the President may grant a 1-time extension of not more than 90 days with respect to the date on which this subsection would otherwise apply to such application pursuant to paragraph (2), if the President certifies to Congress that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC88194A64F774FE4BEF0658100F7E703" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) a path to executing a qualified divestiture has been identified with respect to such application; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H08E969FBC3354689872A544F1FD3C70C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) evidence of significant progress toward executing such qualified divestiture has been produced with respect to such application; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB202C1A5F2EB44ADA61FBDD2F6B2480B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) there are in place the relevant binding legal agreements to enable execution of such qualified divestiture during the period of such extension.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9574CC1E76A845E08021EACA09E0BE1E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Providing internet hosting services to enable the distribution, maintenance, or updating of such foreign adversary controlled application for users within the land or maritime borders of the United States. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5E38C02E012E4FB5A5CCF1573A786032" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Applicability Subject to paragraph (3), this subsection shall apply— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H636689BA78CF41E1BCDBDC65506A015B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) in the case of an application that satisfies the definition of a foreign adversary controlled application pursuant to subsection (g)(3)(A), beginning on the date that is 270 days after the date of the enactment of this division; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24E3290075414FC08C3855C9FD84A471" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) in the case of an application that satisfies the definition of a foreign adversary controlled application pursuant to subsection (g)(3)(B), beginning on the date that is 270 days after the date of the relevant determination of the President under such subsection. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H22D8E2C85C144E68BDA42909FF197DB3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Extension With respect to a foreign adversary controlled application, the President may grant a 1-time extension of not more than 90 days with respect to the date on which this subsection would otherwise apply to such application pursuant to paragraph (2), if the President certifies to Congress that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC88194A64F774FE4BEF0658100F7E703" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) a path to executing a qualified divestiture has been identified with respect to such application; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H08E969FBC3354689872A544F1FD3C70C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) evidence of significant progress toward executing such qualified divestiture has been produced with respect to such application; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB202C1A5F2EB44ADA61FBDD2F6B2480B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) there are in place the relevant binding legal agreements to enable execution of such qualified divestiture during the period of such extension.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5E38C02E012E4FB5A5CCF1573A786032" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Applicability Subject to paragraph (3), this subsection shall apply— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H636689BA78CF41E1BCDBDC65506A015B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) in the case of an application that satisfies the definition of a foreign adversary controlled application pursuant to subsection (g)(3)(A), beginning on the date that is 270 days after the date of the enactment of this division; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24E3290075414FC08C3855C9FD84A471" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) in the case of an application that satisfies the definition of a foreign adversary controlled application pursuant to subsection (g)(3)(B), beginning on the date that is 270 days after the date of the relevant determination of the President under such subsection. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H22D8E2C85C144E68BDA42909FF197DB3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Extension With respect to a foreign adversary controlled application, the President may grant a 1-time extension of not more than 90 days with respect to the date on which this subsection would otherwise apply to such application pursuant to paragraph (2), if the President certifies to Congress that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC88194A64F774FE4BEF0658100F7E703" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) a path to executing a qualified divestiture has been identified with respect to such application; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H08E969FBC3354689872A544F1FD3C70C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) evidence of significant progress toward executing such qualified divestiture has been produced with respect to such application; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB202C1A5F2EB44ADA61FBDD2F6B2480B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) there are in place the relevant binding legal agreements to enable execution of such qualified divestiture during the period of such extension. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9031D21879F14124B906F1DDCE9BD2E3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Data and information portability to alternative applications Before the date on which a prohibition under subsection (a) applies to a foreign adversary controlled application, the entity that owns or controls such application shall provide, upon request by a user of such application within the land or maritime borders of United States, to such user all the available data related to the account of such user with respect to such application.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1CC4FCDAE2F54BA1BC38BBA071BC5050" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Exclusion The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered company does not include an entity that operates a website, desktop application, mobile application, or augmented or immersive technology application whose primary purpose is to allow users to post product reviews, business reviews, or travel information and reviews. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0A2584ACDBA6421CB9228F949380BDFB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Foreign adversary controlled application The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">foreign adversary controlled application means a website, desktop application, mobile application, or augmented or immersive technology application that is operated, directly or indirectly (including through a parent company, subsidiary, or affiliate), by— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFC88714526AB4B2483411D1E7B1AD372" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) any of— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H35C37989583D4F38B8484CC8478DAA65" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) ByteDance, Ltd.; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5449DE1453A54E7889D2B9D6131379B9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) TikTok; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA68DA7D1C4F04F91B45DEBFB2CF5A4BA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) a subsidiary of or a successor to an entity identified in clause (i) or (ii) that is controlled by a foreign adversary; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H978B51D28C444AA3AA9A44E8D54689DE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) an entity owned or controlled, directly or indirectly, by an entity identified in clause (i), (ii), or (iii); or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1091548C462F4DABA787D2F6B52406EC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) a covered company that— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H819F8730A970403CA6D8F38185089094" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) is controlled by a foreign adversary; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC983D075793644D698D2342BEA2D707D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) that is determined by the President to present a significant threat to the national security of the United States following the issuance of— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0FE3F1276494BBB8D41ED002D521C05" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) a public notice proposing such determination; and <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA87C0E697E1246779388E64CC8D4A12A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) a public report to Congress, submitted not less than 30 days before such determination, describing the specific national security concern involved and containing a classified annex and a description of what assets would need to be divested to execute a qualified divestiture. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H14ADA5ED58F64079B9A80EF8768B536B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Foreign adversary country The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">foreign adversary country means a country specified in section 4872(d)(2) of title 10, United States Code.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1CC4FCDAE2F54BA1BC38BBA071BC5050" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Exclusion The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">covered company does not include an entity that operates a website, desktop application, mobile application, or augmented or immersive technology application whose primary purpose is to allow users to post product reviews, business reviews, or travel information and reviews. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0A2584ACDBA6421CB9228F949380BDFB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Foreign adversary controlled application The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">foreign adversary controlled application means a website, desktop application, mobile application, or augmented or immersive technology application that is operated, directly or indirectly (including through a parent company, subsidiary, or affiliate), by— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFC88714526AB4B2483411D1E7B1AD372" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) any of— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H35C37989583D4F38B8484CC8478DAA65" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) ByteDance, Ltd.; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5449DE1453A54E7889D2B9D6131379B9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) TikTok; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA68DA7D1C4F04F91B45DEBFB2CF5A4BA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) a subsidiary of or a successor to an entity identified in clause (i) or (ii) that is controlled by a foreign adversary; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H978B51D28C444AA3AA9A44E8D54689DE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) an entity owned or controlled, directly or indirectly, by an entity identified in clause (i), (ii), or (iii); or <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1091548C462F4DABA787D2F6B52406EC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) a covered company that— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H819F8730A970403CA6D8F38185089094" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) is controlled by a foreign adversary; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC983D075793644D698D2342BEA2D707D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) that is determined by the President to present a significant threat to the national security of the United States following the issuance of— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD0FE3F1276494BBB8D41ED002D521C05" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) a public notice proposing such determination; and <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA87C0E697E1246779388E64CC8D4A12A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) a public report to Congress, submitted not less than 30 days before such determination, describing the specific national security concern involved and containing a classified annex and a description of what assets would need to be divested to execute a qualified divestiture. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H14ADA5ED58F64079B9A80EF8768B536B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) Foreign adversary country The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">foreign adversary country means a country specified in section 4872(d)(2) of title 10, United States Code.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H57DED9B1744D4B8AB0ED5B3A611E0469" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Qualified divestiture The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">qualified divestiture means a divestiture or similar transaction that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC7FAA3514FD94BD88849A370AB4E4EF8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the President determines, through an interagency process, would result in the relevant foreign adversary controlled application no longer being controlled by a foreign adversary; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEDC02B8DE8754ABC97BC9710C50427BE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the President determines, through an interagency process, precludes the establishment or maintenance of any operational relationship between the United States operations of the relevant foreign adversary controlled application and any formerly affiliated entities that are controlled by a foreign adversary, including any cooperation with respect to the operation of a content recommendation algorithm or an agreement with respect to data sharing. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6A1DF7D951C4C9792CC26B8CB3C7E85" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) Source code The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">source code means the combination of text and other characters comprising the content, both viewable and nonviewable, of a software application, including any publishing language, programming language, protocol, or functional content, as well as any successor languages or protocols. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC09ED8B4F91A4D71A0B2A54CBA98F76F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) United states The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">United States includes the territories of the United States.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H57DED9B1744D4B8AB0ED5B3A611E0469" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Qualified divestiture The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">qualified divestiture means a divestiture or similar transaction that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC7FAA3514FD94BD88849A370AB4E4EF8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the President determines, through an interagency process, would result in the relevant foreign adversary controlled application no longer being controlled by a foreign adversary; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEDC02B8DE8754ABC97BC9710C50427BE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the President determines, through an interagency process, precludes the establishment or maintenance of any operational relationship between the United States operations of the relevant foreign adversary controlled application and any formerly affiliated entities that are controlled by a foreign adversary, including any cooperation with respect to the operation of a content recommendation algorithm or an agreement with respect to data sharing. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6A1DF7D951C4C9792CC26B8CB3C7E85" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) Source code The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">source code means the combination of text and other characters comprising the content, both viewable and nonviewable, of a software application, including any publishing language, programming language, protocol, or functional content, as well as any successor languages or protocols. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC09ED8B4F91A4D71A0B2A54CBA98F76F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) United states The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">United States includes the territories of the United States.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H57DED9B1744D4B8AB0ED5B3A611E0469" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Qualified divestiture The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">qualified divestiture means a divestiture or similar transaction that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC7FAA3514FD94BD88849A370AB4E4EF8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the President determines, through an interagency process, would result in the relevant foreign adversary controlled application no longer being controlled by a foreign adversary; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEDC02B8DE8754ABC97BC9710C50427BE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the President determines, through an interagency process, precludes the establishment or maintenance of any operational relationship between the United States operations of the relevant foreign adversary controlled application and any formerly affiliated entities that are controlled by a foreign adversary, including any cooperation with respect to the operation of a content recommendation algorithm or an agreement with respect to data sharing. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6A1DF7D951C4C9792CC26B8CB3C7E85" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) Source code The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">source code means the combination of text and other characters comprising the content, both viewable and nonviewable, of a software application, including any publishing language, programming language, protocol, or functional content, as well as any successor languages or protocols. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC09ED8B4F91A4D71A0B2A54CBA98F76F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) United states The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">United States includes the territories of the United States.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H57DED9B1744D4B8AB0ED5B3A611E0469" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Qualified divestiture The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">qualified divestiture means a divestiture or similar transaction that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC7FAA3514FD94BD88849A370AB4E4EF8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the President determines, through an interagency process, would result in the relevant foreign adversary controlled application no longer being controlled by a foreign adversary; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEDC02B8DE8754ABC97BC9710C50427BE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the President determines, through an interagency process, precludes the establishment or maintenance of any operational relationship between the United States operations of the relevant foreign adversary controlled application and any formerly affiliated entities that are controlled by a foreign adversary, including any cooperation with respect to the operation of a content recommendation algorithm or an agreement with respect to data sharing. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD6A1DF7D951C4C9792CC26B8CB3C7E85" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) Source code The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">source code means the combination of text and other characters comprising the content, both viewable and nonviewable, of a software application, including any publishing language, programming language, protocol, or functional content, as well as any successor languages or protocols. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC09ED8B4F91A4D71A0B2A54CBA98F76F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) United states The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">United States includes the territories of the United States.

<section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H064C385070114C3A8DA14F68F7405CB0" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 3. JUDICIAL REVIEW <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9BBA895414034474899692215D769195" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) Right of action A petition for review challenging this division or any action, finding, or determination under this division may be filed only in the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAA1F28EFA7854EC0BD1DADB0F0358BD5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Exclusive jurisdiction The United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit shall have exclusive jurisdiction over any challenge to this division or any action, finding, or determination under this division.
